intro: Madronella macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered madronella, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland habitats. Its leaves are palmately lobed, providing a distinctive appearance. Madronella macrantha is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
